page.title: 04Customs-GUILDRY VISITS
page.content: 1The Guildry Incorporation of Perth used to own Guildtown. They helped to pay for the building of the School in 1875 and they built most of the old houses you can see about 1820. That is why the present members visit the area and the school every year. At the school there are races after the refreshments. The winners each get a gift voucher. After that we have a scramble usually for brand new twos or one pences but sometimes they include fives and tens. Next one of the older boys or girls makes a speech thanking the Guildry for coming. This visit always takes place on the first Wednesday in June. That that is Derby Day is no co-incident. The Guildry's other visit is to the School Prize-giving Service on the last morning of term usually at the end of June,to give out Guildry Prizes
